medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe congenital hypothyroidism with goiter in a newborn.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at birth with the presence of a large posterior fontanel and mild axial hypotonia. Prolonged jaundice developed, and elevated TSH was detected by neonatal screening. Clinical goiter was noted by day 14, confirming the diagnosis of severe congenital hypothyroidism.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was a full-term 3620-g boy with no specified past medical history. Parents were healthy non-consanguineous individuals.
medical_history.family_history: Parents were euthyroid with normal thyroid volume; no family history of hypothyroidism was mentioned.
